intro: Dinetus dinetoides, commonly known as the yellow-eyed grass, is a flowering plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in spikelets, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Dinetus dinetoides thrives in moist, sunny environments such as wet meadows and streambanks. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and nectar for various pollinators.
